Transcribed 7.9.92. To proof.
With reference to your Letter of the 28th Ultimo No 6137, instructing the Colonial Architect, to prepare and transmit to your Office "the Annual Report of the Botanical Gardens, Melbourne for the Year 1852", I have the honor to state, that it was the intention of the late Honorary Secretary to furnish with the Report, a correct list of all Plants in the Gardens, for which purpose the assistance of the Government Botanist would have been requested: the Honorary Secretary having however since resigned, I beg to suggest that the Government Botanist be instructed to prepare the Report and List before alluded to.
MS annotations: 'Let this be done as soon as he arrives', 'Pending arrival of Government Botanist'. M included a brief report on the Gardens at the end of his 'first general report', i.e. B53.10.01, but no list of the kind mentioned here was appended.
